title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 363.6 - Four-week period following termination of employment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 363.6 - Four-week period following termination of employment

State Regulations

The period of four consecutive weeks after termination of
employment shall end on the 28th consecutive calendar day following the last
day worked except that employment shall not be deemed terminated during any
period when an employee is eligible to receive benefits under section
204
of the Workers' Compensation Law, with respect to such employment and the four
consecutive week period after termination of employment shall, in such case, end on the 28th consecutive calendar day following the last day for which
benefits were paid to such employee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
363.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
